column1: Lombok International Airport (Indonesian: Bandar Udara Internasional Lombok) (IATA: LOP
column2: ICAO: WADL) is a new airport on the island of Lombok in Indonesia. It is the island's only fully operational airport. The Airport is located 34 km South East of the Mataram city. The new airport replaced Selaparang Airport (IATA: AMI
column4: the island's previous sole operational airport
column5: situated at Ampenan on the West coast of Lombok near the capital of Mataram. The airport was officially inaugurated by the President of the Republic of Indonesia
column6: Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono on 20 October 2011. The airport can accommodate widebody high capacity Airbus A330 and Boeing 767 airliners
column7: as well as smaller aircraft such as Boeing 737 and Airbus A320 aircraft already serving Lombok.
